title: You don't have to be positive?
body:
Positivity only encourages others to honor you.
abide that said, you should try your best to be a decent human being.
but not being positive will not get you a ban, its being negative/toxic/flamethrower.

replies.body:
Riot uses a chat filter. Triggering the filter will increase your chance of getting banned.

You can say nothing. Won't increase your chance of getting banned.
You can say positives. Will increase your chance of getting banned. 
You can say negatives. Will greatly increase your chance of getting banned.

Don't worry. I edited out the "crap" for you.
do you have a link where someone is punished for only saying positive things? I'd love to see it
There was a case for passive aggressive where the player kept saying "gj" everytime an ally died. Yes passive aggressive, but debatably also "positive"

I dont think that's debatable

if you're only typing gj when an allies dies, it's clearly meant negatively

Ya .. but those are positive words used in a negative context.

Which really isn't "saying positives" alone.

I agree completely. However, if that person had created their own post (was someone trying to hijack; but did find it) and posted the logs. We probably would have been confused and assumed they were edited.
It’s a popular misconception that chatting enough will inevitably get you in trouble. Wildly unsubstantiated, though.

oh i know, that's why I asked 

I know there's no leg to stand on here

Aside from that, I like to think that decent human beings bring a lot of positivity with them!
